title: Location of Thunderbird profile files - Windows 11
content:
The information I've seen indicates that the Thunderbird profile files for Windows machine resides in the users/appdata/roaming/thunderbird/profiles folder. However, and maybe I'm going crazy, but on a new computer I installed Thunderbird from the Windows store, and the resulting Thunderbird profiles information (upon installation) was seen to be located ONLY in the users/appdata/local folder, and there was NO Thunderbird folder in the users/appdata/roaming folder.

This caused problems with using the instructions for moving email address-book information "abook" files. All of the support information I located directed one to ove the "abook" files to the profile folder located in the users/appdata/roaming/thunderbird path. Since there was no thunderbird folder located in that path, that's a problem.

I uninstalled Thunderbird and re-installed using the application downloaded from the thunderbird.net website. Wella! Now there was a thunderbird folder in the "roaming" folder, and I was able to move the "abook" files from the old computer.
creator: dave.churchill4681

title: An inability to open and use Mozilla Thunderbird
content:
Something happened to my Mozilla Thunderbird account. Suddenly, when I open Thunderbird to check or send emails, all that opens is my list of sent messages. I no longer have my start page which allows me to compose and send and see new messages. I've been trying to get some help for the last three days or so as I'm 75 years old and feel crippled without my email account. I've been using Thunderbird for years and am used to its format and appearance, usability etc. and would just like to get it back to where it was.

Of course, I would like to be able to retain my older sent and received messages and my list of contacts and email addresses etc. I'm assuming that all of my information still exists in my Mozilla Thunderbird account somewhere and am wondering if it can all be restored on my computer. I need assistance in making that happen. I was not raised on computers and can easily get lost in all of the jargon, codes, etc. and my ISP can't help me with much of it other than to refer me to the Mozilla Thunderbird providers.

If nothing else, can I, should I, just download Mozilla Thunderbird again and start anew? I would really rather know that it can all be restored from somewhere if I can find the right link or person to help me and to not keep me bouncing around between robots and automated responses. I've attached a photo of what opens when I try to go into my email. My contacts (correspondents) and their email addys have been blocked out but I've tried to show all of the icons that are available to me, none of which seems to provide a solution to my problem. 

I find that I AM able to receive my email on my ISP's email program but it is a very basic program which is not at all familiar to me. I also have two other email accounts on gmail that seem to be working fine but they are not accounts that were set up for day to day messaging. One of those accounts is associated with my wildlife photography website.

Thank you, in advance, for any assistance from Mozilla Support.
creator: jannu1

title: Messed up my first Thunderbird email POP3 account need help
content:
Hi, I messed up my first email account creation with Thunderbird where I can't see any local emails and my server inbox is now empty (had +200 emails in there). I am in Ubuntu 24.04 LTS.

Here is what I did: 1- went into my server mail and moved every folder emails into my inbox

2- created my Thunderbird POP3 using the automatic process 

   - said to delete emails after being downloaded

3- once created I wanted to create a personnalized folder this account (I have another email to do the same thing). I was pointing to a specific folder before I created a new one: ~/snap/thunderbird/common/.thunderbird/b*.default I pointed it to ~/snap/thunderbird/common/.thunderbird/f*

      • can't remember if these were called profile location or something else. Please explain the purpose of it and when should we need to change it.

4- I went into my mail window and noticed Thunderebird Inbox being empty. I went back to my server inbox and it was also empty. I did not know why nothing was downloaded. I tried using the Get Mail a few times but nothing was happening. Tried to look for Synch something option but could not find any

5- I checked both folders above and saw the default one had tons of stuff why the second one had almost nothing. So I figured that before I had chosen the 2nd folder location, my inbox must have been downloaded into the default one.

6- tried in the console to copy the whole content of the first folder to the second one. I think I restarted at that point, not sure. But in the email list window there was "history.sqlite" listed instead of inbox and "minidumps" below it.

7- I added an import addon, imported the b*.default folder into a 3 one I created, had chosen Offline and restarted. Now in the email window nothing was showing up. I tried Get Mail but it said I needed to get off the Offline mode. I unchecked Working Offline in the File menu but still nothing.

If I do a Thunderbird restart, it asks me which of the 3 profiles I want to start Thunderbird with. If I chose the default one, it shows the history.sqlite and minidumps folders. If I chose the 2nd one I created, it has the same content. If I chose the 3rd one I created with the import, it brings me up to the step where I can create a Thunderbird email account.

Now I have no idea what to do. I still believe all my 200+ emails are in the b*.default folder but how to I switch back to it?

Please tell me I did not loose all those 200+ emails !!!
creator: browser_ice1
